place_description: Our vision for Waterbean Coffee is to create an environment where we are more than just another coffee shop. We’d love for you to think of us as an extension of your home or business.

reviews_data.review_text: Great coffee place. Local musicians play at times.
Very nice place, quiet, great atmosphere
I love their food and their employees are great
What a precious little coffee shop in the adorable town of Pineville. I have decided this is going to be my new hangout. Tried their in store brewed iced tea.  Delightful!

Stopped here before a work event. The cashier didn't greet me until I said something. I ordered a Coconut Matcha, she asked "hot or iced?" I said hot. She paused, hit a bunch of buttons, said "you said iced right?"

Ended up leaving after that. I guess their employees aren't morning people. Funny.
Very sweet place
Really great place
Cute place, yummy coffee, good food

Absolutely loved this sweet little coffee shop!! The baristas were so helpful, and they took such good care of me during my visit. I usually feel rushed when I am in a coffee shop, and they made me feel as if I could've stayed for hours and it would not have bothered them one bit. Also, the GF&V chocolate chip muffin was delicious!! I definitely will be returning. 10/10 recommend.
Great coffee.
Amazing ambiance to have a coffee date and chill out.
Very good coffee. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Wife and I came here for coffee and a light breakfast and it wasn't as great as we would have hoped. The area around the coffee shop is cute and it was nice to sit outside, but besides that we were not that impressed. I got the famous iced coffee and my wife got a flavored latte of some sort and neither one of us thought it was all that good. My wife got the blueberry peach muffin and I got the avocado toast. Muffin had little to no flavor and the avocado toast was not even toasted. It came out as hot bread with a smear of avocado and balsamic drizzle on top. Would not suggest this place to visitors and won't return. Staff was nice and patient while we ordered.
Not friendly staff. The bagel tasted like a cheap store bought. Packed the food to go for some reason, by the time was plated it turned cold. I would not recommend. Drinks were good.

Two awesome special/seasonal drinks - paradise latte and orange creamsicle! The guy who took our order was a nice guy, and the drinks came out pretty quick. This shop was a nice little local spot to stop for coffee on our way out of town. We'll be back when we're in the area again. Definitely recommend you give it a try!
Just great!
Excellent place to get some work knocked out while enjoying great coffee
I have been trying local coffees and Coffee here tastes very bad.
Excellent service, hands down ! I rushed from church on a Sunday evening and it was 5 mins to closing yet the barista's made me my latte without vexation which is truly a virtue. Thankyou so much !!

My husband and I recently visited from Texas and loved it so much we came back the second day! The fig green tea is amazing! I highly recommend for their lattes, loose leaf tea, breakfast sandwiches and service.

A cute little spot to chill out, get some work done, or see friends. They have unique drinks and friendly staff! I got the maple bacon latte and it is GOOD!
Their macarons are also delicious! I highly recommend the lemon berry!
Staff is always super helpful. Love how they remember my name.
The most disorganized and inconsistent coffee place I have ever had the displeasure of going to. They have been open too long to have this many issues.
Went to grab coffee with my girlfriend and got the Dr.Congo blend and iced chai tea. Really enjoyed the coffee. Would recommend!

Terrible staff, ownership, management.  So sad they were upset we had a group who popped in for coffee but they asked us to be quiet and sit down.  Apparently they have regular customers who come there to work on thier computers and expected a quiet atmosphere.  The libraryvis next door too.  We will NEVER go back. We were all paying customers too but $6 coffee is served other places with a smile. Gzzz what a way to ruin a rainy afternoon.  Not reccommended.

Got to add to my previous review. The service gets worse. Seems like they have new inexperienced baristas all the time. Today was the worst. Got to return whatever was prepared as Americano and get my refund.
"Three times I visited this coffeeshop. The place itself is good, lots of tables and electrical plugs to work with computers. The service however is inconsistent, One time Americano was great with two side little chocolates, another time it tasted watery. Customer service is not friendly, not sure if they are getting any training to greet customers properly. Restrooms are not taking care, advised them that they are out of towels, no one took care of it. This place could have been great with proper customer service training and consistent coffee quality."

It's a cute and nice spot for a coffee break. The baristas are always friendly and quick with the drinks. The Sweet Melody and the East and West croissant sandwiches are definitely the best food on the menu. My favorite drink is the snickerdoodle iced latte. It's definitely a must try!

Definitely a step or two up from Starbucks. This place is clean and runs like a well-oiled machine. Honestly don't even prefer Starbucks, but it's an easy decision when places like Waterbean exists. Cleanliness and attention to detail are important to us, and this place delivers on all accounts.
Good breakfast and drink menu. Cold drip is fantastic
Coffee is great, the atmosphere of the place is really good too. A little pricey though.
Enjoyed the vibe and my espresso!
My go-to coffee spot. Service is always fast and friendly. I love their hot vanilla latte and "morning sunrise" sandwich. My kids love sitting by the window to look at the cars passing by.

Overall a really nice coffee shop, comfortable place to get work done and enjoy a good cup of coffee. Lots of tables and good wi-fi. Latte and americano that my partner and I got were delicious and well-balanced. The pumpkin crumble muffin and breakfast croissant sandwich were good too. The service is a little lacking- the baristas asked multiple times if my items were for here to which I said yes, and all of my items came in to-go containers... the items all took a long time- the sandwich took 20 minutes, the woman who took my order was not attentive/engaged during our interaction. It's a great coffee shop but it seems all of the baristas just could use some service reminders.

Just so relaxing. Very well made and real flavorful food. Ingredients all seemed like good quality. I had a wonderful fresh brewed  Iced tea and a vegetable egg that I had placed on lettuce instead of bread. Very very satisfied.
Love this coffee shop! Delicious coffee, excellent baristas who are friendly and knowledgeable! I can hear the theme of the old show "cheers" in my head when I walk in!

Fine cup of coffee. A few single origins available and a few different brew methods.
The washed Ethiopian coffee I had via Aeropress was under extracted but still a decent cup of coffee.
This shop seems to cater to everyone. Sugary Sbux like drinks, tea, pastry, batch brew coffee and handbrewed.
Probably the best coffee in Pineville.
Delicious coffee in a cute downtown setting.

What a delightful coffee shop! My husband and I are very particular about our coffee, and we recently discovered the local Waterbean chain. Each location is unique, but they all serve the same  amazing organic coffee and teas. You can try a flight of espresso or coffee, or a variety of brew methods, including an Aeropress! This location is our favorite. The helpful employees are friendly and cheerful, especially Amor, Kate and Maurizio. There are plenty of tables inside and out to linger over a cup of amazing coffee or tea, or study, read a good book or catch up with a friend. Highly recommended!

Recently visited this coffee shop on my journey to find good coffee. I got the cold foam snickerdoodle which was a good blend of sweet on top with the coffee taste at the bottom. Very spacious to sit down and do schoolwork or talk with friends. Friendly staff and quick service, would recommend coming here for a relaxed mood.

Cute little spot to get some work done. I had their famous iced coffee and a slice of coffee cake. Enjoyable Sunday afternoon in the heart of adorable downtown Pineville. My server was super accommodating with my indecisiveness.
Iced coffee and iced latte taste great.  Fast service, clean and bright place.

Very cushioned and pretty  (even the high tops) seating, lots of table for computer work, , spacious floor plan, great service, great coffee, nice breakfast menu and slight changes to menu items are no problem! Very friendly and fast staff.
It used to be good but not anymore. Coffees and teas are not prepared as they should and served cold. This place used to great.
Delightful coffee shop, warmly welcomed and prompt service. The coffee was delicious and little desserts were delicious! Great place to meet up with friends. Very clean and well organized.
Favorite coffee joint! They have such good coffee cake! And the macaroons are pretty poppin too!
The coffee was good
Great hot latte'.  The app works really well and the pick up window outside makes my morning coffee a breeze.

i'm very disappointed in this place. I've called in an order 3 times before and i tried to call in an order to pick up today, and i was turned down from a lady with a serious attitude saying I have to come in to place my order. Will not be ordering from here again.
Great coffee and great service.  Coffee is one of the most pesticide ridden agricultural products..... It's nice that this place serves organic coffee that has not been "pesticided".

I tried their Paradise Latte and my sister tried their Spice Vanilla Latte and let me tell you they were amazing!!! You can get cold foam on any latte, I suggest you try it! The Lavender Latte tasted like boba, caramel and berries! Definitely coming back!
Food was lovely. Amazing coffee, lots of choices (plus monthly specials) something for everyone.
Wonderful coffee.   We stayed in the area for two days and I think we stopped here four or five times.
I had a Red Eye and a slice of Coffee Cake... perfect!
Love the food and atmosphere. Great little town as well. The avocado toast and scones are to due for.

I love this place. Truly. But because I like the food and the location so much I often am also frustrated by the amateur way that it is run.

Two examples:
1.  I ordered avocado toast. Then I was told they have run out of avocados. So I ordered the smoked salmon. And guess what -- I was then told they were out of Salmon too. Why not cross the things off the menu when you're out? Or when you have a chance to tell me that you have no avocados, also tell me that you have no salmon! And how about an apology instead of a blank stare. "I'm so sorry, but we are out of several things today... Avocados, and salmon" would sure go along way.

2.  When I completed my order, I was told I should sit down and that they would find me. I thought this meant my food would be delivered. Nope. It means they will call out what you ordered and set it on the bar to get cold. They did not ask my name so they could not call me by name. And I didn't know the menu name of what I had ordered, so I did not recognize that. The place was busy and noisy so I did not hear them call much of anything... My sandwich sat on the bar for a long time before I got so hungry I went looking.

The big things are done really well at this place. The pastries, sandwiches, and oh my the coffee... All are terrific. Now, if they could just ice the little things -- like customer service -- it would be my favorite place.  I'll add a 5th star when that happens!

So the coffee was super good, but it was also $15 for two small cups (one iced latte, one hot latte). Plus they charge 75 cents for oat milk which I think nowadays is just unnecessary. Oat milk is probably cheaper to buy than regular milk nowadays anyway. It also took about 20 minutes, which was long enough that I honestly figured someone took our order by accident.

The few times I have gone to this Waterbean, my orders have been great.
Today I ordered off the app, a vietnamese coffee. There was no condensed milk, it honestly tasted like a regular iced coffee w milk.
Nice spot. fancy place with friendly people and good coffee
Excellent service, coffee drinks, and breakfast items. Very nice atmosphere. I highly recommend!
Great people great coffees awesome atmosphere very lofi chill step vibes. Great study spot
The food is really good.
Best coffee in Pineville
Lots of options to choose from, the wait time is long sometimes.
Great coffee. Good food (more than just munchies, danishes, and basic coffee shop fare), plus I'm able to get some work done.
Cute spot with great coffee! Loved the honey lavender coffee
My mate Joshua K Phillips aka Tobias says this place has some pukker coffee, and the staff awesome. Never 'Bean' there but I hear great things
Over $4.00 for ice tea!

Customer service is a heavy part of my ratings & the barista was super amazing!! The guy cashier who was originally supposed to take my order was unprofessional as he stayed on his phone when I came up. Really, I'm not Karen, but if you stay on it as I'm standing there, it's quite awkward. I told him I needed a second & luckily I had another employee serve me.
I asked for a recommendation in which she thought of the white chocolate caramel latte (which was on point). I was inquisitive about a couple things & she was very knowledgeable & even let me try the nicaraguan drip coffee.  She encapsulates the personality that draws people in. Great coffee alone doesn't flourish a business, the people do. <3
Wish the coffee was actually mixed. I miss unwind and probably won't go back in the future because it's such a downgrade

Do I miss the quaint cozy hometown vibes of Unwind? Yes! But I really think Waterbean has done a great job of opening up the space and adding lots of seating. I personally love how white and minimalist everything is, I think it makes it easier to focus when there's less distraction and things to look at on the walls. I do think a few more plants could be a great addition. Love that there are two restrooms! The green tea frappe was delicious and I'll look forward to trying some loose leaf teas and gluten free vegan treats next time I come in to do some work
Good coffee and service but wow what a basic look.  Mostly bare white walls. Not the cozy coffee place I was expecting.
The whole experience was enjoyable!
Always a warm welcome and a great coffee. Thank you.

Very friendly service, cozy space with ideal lighting and a variety of seating options. One of the few cafes in the area that stays open on the later end! Excellent warm muffins (not pictured as I ate it pretty quick haha), and I'd definitely recommend this mango passion fruit smoothie!
Favorite coffee shop
Nice location downtown Pineville. I've had the Chai Latte and Macaroons, which were both really. Prices are very decent.
It was busy, but worth the wait. I loved that they had dairy free options and gluten free treats for me!

I had the  WORST CUP OF COFFEE from here Today! I am not sure why, but the coffee seemed thicker than normal, it was supposed to be a small medium brew coffee with a shot of sugar-free vanilla, The Taste was absolutely horrible, it left a very bad aftertaste, and I began to feel nauseous while sipping on it, and I just threw it away!

Calm, clean, friendly. There's a lot of places to sit. They make good coffee. Cinnamon French toast latte was my favorite. The matcha frappe was ok wasn't much matcha flavor. Service was great. They have a very large menu of teas and my sister says they do a good job making them.
Nice coffeeshop with good coffee and some small bites. Had coffee and a couple of breakfast sandwiches. All was good.
Always a great joy visiting this coffee shop! Great food, wonderful coffee & lovely staff as a cherry on top!
I've never been in a waterbean I didn't like! Always great services and good coffee and food!
For the price esthetic and area It's an all around great place. I had 2 latteas One hot and one iced.I loved them both. My only complaints are the macarons

I came here pretty frequently while it was still Unwind Coffee and Tea before it was bought by waterbean. I think Unwind had everything nailed. The atmosphere and decor was spot on and perfect. It was cozy and comfy and just overall a great vibe along with fantastic coffee. I was skeptical when Waterbean bought it, but thought I would still try it out. They have completely ruined the warmth in this coffee shop while trying to convert it to a "modern" coffee shop. It's all white and plain. There's no life to the place anymore. It's boring, bland and cold in its style. When I look for a place to spend time I want somewhere inviting and cozy. This place just no longer has that. The way it was when it was "Unwind" was perfect. They captured every aspect of what a coffee shop should be. It's a bummer Waterbean isn't able to hold onto that. On top of that, their coffee is subpar at best and I wish they still had the many tea options as before. It made the place unique. Now it's just another boring chain coffee shop.
Great place, cool atmosphere. Coffee is pretty good, I told the staff it was my first time & they made a great reccomendation. The food was alright, not the tastiest but decent.

Unwind Tea and coffee, RIP. I'm biased  because I loved the previous establishment, Unwind. This acquisition is so disappointing. The latte came out meh making me want to give up on coffee shops altogether. Place was a little dirty. When i asked for napkins they said they have some and when I looked it was just dirty crumbled napkins left. I said it's empty and when she refilled she put the dirty crumbled napkins on top. It's with a heavy heart that I'm done with this location. Was fun while it lasted.

Nice atmosphere. Lots of seating
Soft music
Relax flow
Quick service.
Great Service; both staff were pleasant
New establishment/owners already fitting into the Main St. ways of respectable business.
Easy to spot from traffic.
Close to Carolina Scoops, The Garrison, Game room and more.

What a terrible place! They took 30 minutes to take our order. We paid for coffee and breakfast, but the breakfast never showed up. I was so disgusted that we just left.

The two people working were trying their hardest, but it is completely unorganized.  They don't even ask for a name when you order food, so how they know who it's for is beyond me.
A great new addition to the area

Everything is amazing! They are an upscale coffee shop catered to middle/upper class. Their regular cup of tea. 12 OZ is $4. I've never paid so much for a cup of hot water with a little bit of hers in it.
The service was amazing! Above and beyond!
The place is really cool if you like quiet, modern, clean, peaceful and classy. Not sure how comfortable the chairs are. You'd have to decide on your own.
Clean and nice place, very friendly service.
Loved this place but its currently closed till at least November
I love everything on the food menu. Believe I've tried them  all!!@
Very nice atmosphere, super friendly staff, delicious coffee, and the poppyseed muffin was perfect!
They are closed.
So sad to see this place go! I don't know where to find great loose tea in the Charlotte area.
Nice place to stay, cozy. The staff is very friendly and the place is clean, would recommend
Love this Cafe. The Avocado Tomato Toast on Rosemary Bread is amazing.
Nice and cozy place

Their chai latte is delicious! I drink chais everywhere, and their chai stands out.
Also, the service is wonderful! They're all friendly and helpful. They really really really listen and want to help you. They take their time to explain everything and give you lots of options for what you want.
The egg and cheese sandwich is amazing too. They don't save on the ingredients. It's big and filling! And not too salty, as they tend to make it in most places.
Thank you!!!

Second time at this charming Tea and Coffee Shop. In the heart of quaint downtown Pineville and offering a wide selection of teas and coffees along with fresh tasty treats and lunchtime bites.  Prompt service with a side of friendly conversation. Limited outdoor seating, but plenty of indoor seating at tables or sofa style.  Will definitely be back!
First time visiting. It was great!

Nice place! Good breakfast flatbread and decent coffee(the aioli tastes like ranch tho, which isn't bad unless you don't like ranch). They took a very long time to get the flatbread out to me. I waited like 25 minutes and it wasn't even that busy. I'd go back but definitely not somewhere to stop if you're in a rush
Very nice atmosphere and friendly service great food.

I've been going to this coffee shop for a few years. Long enough for it to have moved to a couple doors down and back to it's original location. I'm a big fan of the cold brew and this last time I had incredible avocado toast.

Mannnnn Charlotte got some excellent coffee shops !!! This is the second one I have been to since visiting this weekend. AMAZING coffee. Like really good! The staff was also so sweet and helpful in helping me decide which latte to choose. I got the Creme Brule!!!! 10/10 recommend
Nice place and coffee but plz wear masks during this pandemic

It's such a cute and cozy coffee place. It's so quiet and peaceful to work here. Their coffee is very good. They also sell sandwiches and paninis. You can also find many unique flavoured tea from them.

My family and I stumbled upon this place and it was absolutely worth it. The chicken sandwich was wonderful and the coffee and tea selections are very unique. Loved the Boujee Cinnamon Latte! Well done! Everyone needs to experience this charming destination with convenient parking
Great Chai tea, excellent atmosphere and staff

Stopped for coffee and a bite to eat based on other google reviews. Beautiful place inside, a little comfy, a little industrial. Very clean. Friendly staff working here. They have loose tea of all kinds and flavors. I got a latte which was perfect (not too hot and not too cool) If you love plants they have some hanging from the ceiling in the cutest hangers. Tables outside on Main St. Free public parking on side street (Dover).
Iced Coffee w/ Oatmilk was very good, try the Avocado Toast or the Bacon Egg and Cheese on your favorite bread, lots of Salad and lunch sandwhiches to go with a Tea or Coffee

I can't say enough good things about this place. Wendy and her staff are phenomenal and very pleasant. The atmosphere and food is amazing, ESPECIALLY the breakfast flatbread with salsa. This is a must have!!!  The coffee and incredibly wide selection of teas is also mind blowing. This has become my go to spot in the mornings for my coffee and food fix to start my day off right. Plus it's a privately owned local business.

Unwind is one of the few local options where you can still enjoy +  as dine-in -- spaced out and with safety measures/distancing in place.

Family-owned cafe and coffee/tea shop with a rotating breakfast/lunch options. Kid-friendly, free parking nearby and good price value.
We love Unwind! Our favorite Saturday morning coffee and breakfast spot. We are so thankful to have a great spot close by. Highly recommend the Avocado toast!
